Reviews.Title: “Excellent simplified stay”
Reviews.Author: fred n
Reviews.Content: This is a great funky simple hotel at extremely attractive rates for business trips to Singapore. Staff services are great and if you dont expect F&B services as none in the hotel, you will love the decor and simplicity of the place whilst providing everything you need for a comfortable short stay - well done

Reviews.Title: “Small, noisy, cheap(ish)”
Reviews.Author: Nando1982
Reviews.Content: The Saff is where I stay when I want a no frills hotel but don't quite want to stoop to Hotel 81 standards. Run by the same people that operate The Scarlet Hotel, The Saff pretty much uses the same formula of providing relatively low-cost stays but with a nice overall experience. It's well maintained, clean, new, somewhat stylish and has friendly staff. It's a boutique hotel, so facilities are minimal. It's also a converted heritage shop row, so the design and layout has had to make some compromises (like The Scarlet). This means that rooms are tiny, and bathrooms are the size of a shower cubicle, and footsteps are loud in the hallway. On both my stays, my room has faced the main road, which gets ridiculously noisy not only with the passing traffic and locals eating across the road, but with blaring music and some muppet talking on a microphone. Try asking for a room on the other side of the hotel. It may be quieter (I don't know). Overall, if you can get cheap rates for this hotel through an online site, it's a pretty neat little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean room in the mid of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Lawtrash
Reviews.Content: The room is very small but clean n seems to be newly renovated. It is a pity that the room I stayed in does not hv a window. The location is great. U can find good food around the area n the hawker center is just 5min walk away. Also short walking distance to Outram n Chinatown train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Value, Clean, and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ZIGGYBURGOS
Reviews.Content: The Saff Hotel is nearby Chinatown and you can walk, using Neil Rd, to all the main attraction of old Singapore. It has an excellent location because it is between two MRT stations, and there are hundreds of restaurants, shops, and bars to chose from. In fact, right next door to the hotel you find the bar HOOD, the restaurant YANTI, and one SEVEN ELEVEN: all great places to have fun, a beer, and a snack. On weekend it can get noisy. Great value, very clean, people are friendly, and rooms have nice designs. After 10PM go for a stroll on the streets around the hotel for an interesting look at the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: thirroul
Reviews.Content: Great for value and central. Clean rooms but small. Comfortable bed and pillows. Must ask for a window, when you book!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlamencoSoul
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Room quite small. Bathroom small but nice. Didn't like the fixed shutter bathroom door because it doesn't give you too much privacy. The staff was not overly friendly but if you ask for help they are willing to help you anytime. They seemed too busy to even say hi to you when you come in or bye when you go out. There is a coffee shop across the street from hotel where you can get some toast and coffee, for breakfast but no more. It was a little hard to find a place close by to have anything else though.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: jwyh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in November, booked on agoda for US$150 net. It is a unique boutique hotel in Chinatown, painted colourfully throughout. The bathrooms were very small but clean, the rooms were also small but beds were comfortable. We had a window but kept the curtains closed due to the noise. There was a bar playing live music next door until quite late at night (this was Tuesday) but I was so tired, I fell asleep wtihout until the morning. The location was fantastic, quite close to MRT and its quite fun to wander around the streets. It was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: burmans
Reviews.Content: We really liked staying here. Despite the rumours about the noise we found this a really quiet place. we had a room with a very small window but the place itself was really special and for the price I doubt you'd find better in Singapore. room size was pretty good for Singapore standards and while far from chepit was cheaper than most places in Singapore. Location was superb, lots of shops, food places and markets within walking distance, yet in the morning it only took us about 20 minutes to get to the airport. A really charming hotel with some nice boutique touches. Bed was very soft and comfortable for those of us who find Asian beds very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Beat my expectations with its location and charm”
Reviews.Author: leavesofgrass
Reviews.Content: I got this room for about US$120 net, and considering how expensive hotels in Singapore have become, this place is good value for money. The best thing about this place as every other reviewer notes is the location - next to Chinatown, close to every place you'd want to go in Singapore inc Clarke Quay and Boat Quay area. Rooms are tiny, mine was not even 10 sqm but since this place was recently refurbished last year, they are nicely furnished with a clean, comfortable bed. I actually found the furnishings to be a nice touch, with a charm rarely seen in Asian hotels, boutique or otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Bob-Kajang
Reviews.Content: Recently I've been spending a lot of time in Singapore and have been disappointed at the falling standards (and rising prices!) of many of the local hotels - Gallery Hotel please take note. On a whim I tried the Saff and was pleasantly surprised. On the negative side the top floor rooms don't have windows and the hotel doesn't serve breakfast but, as I spend very little time actually in the room and there are lots of places outside to eat, neither of these is a problem. The Saff is well located for Chinatown and a great base for the rest of Singapore. One of the reviewers commented that it's a little pricey but as they went on to say "Singapore is SO expensive". Can you get cheaper than the Saff? Yes - but it depends what you're looking for. I want clean rooms, good telecommunications and good location. The Saff delivers all of these at a price that, for Singapore, is reasonable. I'll be back there again later this week - my fourth time in five weeks. Keep up the good work guys...

Reviews.Title: “worth for money”
Reviews.Author: unnie83
Reviews.Content: Its an old chinese style building, just 5minutes from MRT. Take off at Outram Park Station and head to New Bridge road exit, and you just walk to the right after you out from the station for New Bridge Road. Otherwise, you will exit in front of Singapore General Hospital. From here, you need to cross to The Saff. Their staffs are friendly, although we need to wait for about 15 mins before get our room, but its okay.I suggest better to book through phone than online. If you book online, they didnt confirm ur room and its subject to availability. We booked for 3 superior room (1 queen size, 2 for twin beds). But on the day we check in, they only 1 room with twin beds left. And the size of room are different. I can say i'm lucky enough to get twin bedroom, that are much bigger than the other 2 rooms; but with no window. If you are a sensitive sleeper, i suggest try to get room without window. Quite and you wont hear anything from. can sleep well. There are no breakfast included. The price only for room. But dont worry. easy to get chinese food along the road towards chinatown. For muslim who are looking for halal food, Yanti nasi padang just nearby, about 2-3 units from here.

Reviews.Title: “nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: magmax77 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Chinatown in an area with a couple of small hotels. It consists of a number of renovated colonial buildings. 2 metro stations are close by. The hop-on-hop-off sigthseeing buses have a stop just around the corner. The busy area of chinatown is just a few minutes walk. The interior design of the hotel did appeal to me very much. Modern oriental, asian, colonial fusion design. Everything looks new. The room was a bit small with a queen size bed but the bathroom nearly had the same size as the room. Free WLAN offered at the room and they have a pc in the lobby area. Reception staff was helpful all the time. We did not have breakfast. I am not even sure if they have a restaurant or bar, but there are a couple of bars just next door or across the street. It seems to be an area for nightlife but when we stayed there there was not very much going on (we stayed there during the week). We enjoyed the stay very much and would prefer the hotel again in contrast to the large chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the night life! Soft beds!!”
Reviews.Author: farmngal
Reviews.Content: This was a great little boutique hotel to stay in. The staff was friendly and always very helpful to us. This hotel was located within walking distance to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay. It was really an easy walk to just about anything! It is located right outside China Town. We didn't spend alot of time there; just a walk through but there are lots of restaurants there to choose from if you are in the mood for Chinese food. The MRT Outram station is located around the corner and very easy to access from the hotel. It is about a 5 minute walk. From the airport to the hotel by the train will take around 45 minutes. We read many reviews on this hotel before booking. The common complaint was that the hotel was noisy. We purposefully asked for a room with no window on the back side not facing the street. There were two small windows in the bathroom. We found this room to be comfortable and just what we needed. There is a bar located next door that gets cranked up of a night 9p but we didn't hear any noise from the bar. The first morning that we were there we overslept because it was so quite.We had room 112. The beds were very comfortable and soft. I didn't like the pillows but that was a personal preface not something wrong with them. I just prefer a soft pillow and they were more firm. The rooms and bathroom was good size. We had a safe and fridge in the room. There was also wireless wifi in the room that worked great. The only complaint that my husband had was the king bed was actually 2 double beds put together. He thought it was strange to have "Ricky and Lucy" beds but I was fine with it because that meant I got my own covers! lol This is a new hotel. Some taxi drivers don't know where it is. Just tell the hotel 1929. They all seemed to know this hotel and it is directly across the street. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. Good location, clean, good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel if you don’t care about service.”
Reviews.Author: Kate_Syd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mainly because Singapore is soooooooooo expensive. The rooms were lovely in décor and very clean. The location is also great. The service however at this hotel is awful. We aren’t demanding guests at all and didn’t depend on the hotel staff for anything but they were just outright rude and made us feel a little like we should be serving them. It’s such a shame because it’s a really nice hotel. The bed’s are really hard and pillows very uncomfortable. We stayed 2 nights as we were flying in and out of Singapore so one night at the start and our last night was also spent there. So I wouldn’t spend a week there but for a couple of nights it’s okay. All being said we probably would go back just because of the location and price. So stay if your aren’t motivated by service.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in the heart of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: a979
Reviews.Content: The Saff Hotel is a cozy boutique hotel in the heart of Chinatown, just five minutes away from the Temple, the street market and the Chinatown underground station. Rooms are quite small but nice and clean, and there's a complimentary wi-fi service. A few rooms don't have any window, I advice to check this before arriving if it might be an issue. Personnel is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent transport links. Reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: s22urf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights on business during my first visit to Singapore. The street is a little less salubrious at night than I was expecting, but it is placed between two udnerground stations and is only a short stroll form the chinatown markets and some great chinese restaurants. Inside the rooms are comfortable if a little small, and were remarkably quiet at night. Fine for a few nights only, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, very well located”
Reviews.Author: vaeltaja_80
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Saff for five nights and were overall pretty pleased with our choise. Firstly, the location: the hotel is located on a side-street at the edge of Chinatown. So for dinner you have plenty of places to choose from. We liked the Maxwell Rd. Hawker and Smith St. in Chinatown. The hotel doesn't offer breakfast but the receptionists were very helpful to point us to some nice cafes close by. The MRT station Outram park (both for the purple and the green line) is within 5 min. walking distance. The second thing we liked was the room overall: we stayed in the standard room on the ground floor (no window). The hotel has been quite recently renovated and the decor was nice. Although the room was quite small, it was comfortable for our purposes: sleeping and having a shower. Separate shower cubicle so no showering over the toilet seat (which seem to be the case with many hotels of the same price range)! Good aircon as well. Sound-proofing could be better, so wear earplugs if you are a light sleeper. I think the sounds from the hallway weren't too loud, though, since it had wall-to-wall carpeting.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: bigyabbie
Reviews.Content: So here I am sitting in my room, the wide flat screen tv in the background, nice fast internet, a comfy seeming bed, nice clean white sheets and very cool room fit out with funky chinese touches and strong vibrant colours. The receptionist tonight was great, even when I rang directly and asked how to book and ensure I got a room with a window when booking through an online service to get it cheaper. Then even friendlier when I turned up, remembering my call. Check in was pleasant and fluid. My room is surely small, between 2 and 3 feet longer than the bed, and i guess twice it's width, I can imagine it being a squeeze for two people with lots of bags. My Bathroom is immaculate and I am tempted to take a few photos of some details I like for the carpenters doing my bathroom at home as I write... I like a room with a window simply as that claustrophobic feeling is not so nice, but in reality in this long skinny hotel, made from renovated row house/shops, the disadvantage of the window is it faces the street and the street noise is a bit annoying at times. I am hoping/presuming it will calm down a bit later. Double glazing the windows might well help with the street noise... No room service, no cafe, so no breaky included, though in reality I imagine they could do a deal with the food mall across the road and even just a jug for coffee would be nice I came here as a medical tourist, and in fact the hotel is a 5 min walk from the hotel and it's MRT station one direction and downtown china town in the other. But so far I am damned impressed Boutique hotel at a budget price in a great location I WILL be back, as Singapores hotel prices are in general overpriced for what you get compared to Indonesia where I am based

Reviews.Title: “Noisy - not for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: MrCushtie
Reviews.Content: The Saff is a small hotel in Chinatown, a few doors down from a temple and across the road from another small hotel. The interior is decorated a bit like an explosion in a Bollywood wardrobe: no, I have no idea why there are two swings in the lobby. I didn’t think to ask. The carpets are nice – wall to wall rattan in the corridors and the rooms, and the doors to each room are brightly painted front doors from houses, which gives the hotel an interesting feel, slightly different to the cookie-cutter, standardized approach in larger establishments. Rooms are fairly small, but bigger than the previous hotel I stayed at in Singapore; you actually get a wardrobe here, and a bathroom where the toilet and the shower are separated by a glass door, rather than one spraying down on the other. Though the room is a decent size, the bed is still pretty small, but it was comfortable enough for a week’s stay. On my own. You wouldn’t get two people to sleep in that bed. You get free wifi (a bugbear of mine is how many hotels don’t offer this) and a couple of free bottles of water every day as well. And if you’re me, you get kept up every night by the karaoke joint downstairs. Every night, from ten until 1am, there were the dulcet tones of some woman massacreing various songs from the Nineties, and occasionally this tedium would be broken up by a man playing Radiohead on an acoustic guitar. Ineptly. I put up with this on the first night for an hour or so, then got dressed and went downstairs to complain. Nobody seemed to be on duty on the front desk and I went out to the street to look for the source of the noise… Only to be greeted with dead silence. Well, maybe there was a small dog playing with a piece of litter, but the street was dark and deserted. I felt a bit embarrassed. I walked to the nearby 7-11 and purchased a revolting chocolate bar, as if that was exactly why I’d charged out onto the street at 10:30 on a Monday night. And then, not seeing signs of life, I returned to the hotel. I went back upstairs and as soon as I was in my room, the din ensued once more. This sequence repeated itself several times that night and for the rest of the week, until I feared for my sanity, both from sleep deprivation and from the nagging suspicion that the other guests in the hotel were conducting some week-long prank on me. I would have taken it up with the staff, but I never saw anyone apart from when I was sprinting out the door to get to the office. So: suitable if you’re hellbent on being out on the lash until 1am so you miss the karaoke, or if you’re down there singing your heart out, or if you’re passed out drunk and sleep through it. (Tried that one night, didn’t work for me.) Less suitable if you’re in Singapore for work like I was, although if I could have found the time to be moved to a room on the 3rd floor, or not facing the street, then perhaps the phantasmal karaoke lounge would have wreaked less havoc with my sleep schedule.

Reviews.Title: “let down by one member of staff”
Reviews.Author: boojeedoojee
Reviews.Content: This nice enough hotel was the final location for our South East Asia tour, but due to one female member of staff our stay was not as enjoyable as it could have been.upon arrival this dour woman proceeded to treat us with contempt, possibly as we had back packs on and were both quite tired looking. We had however already paid for the room so this was totally unacceptable behaviour. She eventually checked us into our room after seemingly checking proof of our ID numerous times. Our room itself was very nice, apart from the rooms aircon facility looking quite shabby, there was nothing to complain about. The staff the following morning could not have done more to help us, giving us maps and directions etc for our days plan. When going back to the hotel to check out though, the dour faced woman had replaced the friendly staff member and proceeded to make checking out just as time cosuming and difficult as checking in was. She also failed to tell us the hotel adds a fee on for simply booking a taxi for you, something we found out upon arrival at the airport, and being at the end of our travels, a surprise we could have done without. If the hotel employed a friendlier face than her i would stay again, but knowing this woman may be controlling things again i would recommend staying somewhere different if not a businessman in a suit conveying the right image.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Allwet10
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at The Saff Hotel for a short 4 night stay in Singapore. Taking into account extraordinary Singapore hotel prices, The Saff was a good choice. The greatest assets of the hotel are that it is in pristine condition and like new with stylish boutique decor. The location is great as well as it is just a short walk to the heart of Chinatown, the MRT and several cheap and delicious hawker centers. The biggest drawback to this hotel is that it is incredibly small and cramped. I am not a big person by any means and I had a very difficult time navigating the room and especially the bathroom. It seemed that my elbows were constantly bumping into a wall or door. Also, the free Wifi was inconsistent with a spotty signal. Overall, I would choose to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. Worth another stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShuCheng
Reviews.Content: Was worried that the hotel was noisy as I stayed in hotel 1929 just opposite the street and could not sleep well. Am pleasantly surprised that the room given to us was quiet and clean. With the price I paid it's much more worth than the other hotels I tried in Singapore. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: sanderva
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Saff, prebooked, not discounted. A street view room was booked for us, but we were shown to a room at the back of the hotel. No view, no windows, just a door going to a fire exit. This sounds terrible but it isn't. We had stayed in Indonesia in windowsless rooms, and had learned that they can have advantages too. So did our room at the Saff. It was very nicely appointed, spacious with an entry compartment and a sleep compartment and the bathroom was lovely. The room was also super quiet, really! We slept like a log, what do you want more in busy Singapore. The location is fine. No breakfast in the hotel, but a super friendly Chines style breakfast place on the other side of the stree, where the prices were rock bottom and the staff top: the second morning they remembered what we had had the day before, the newspaper included! Next to the Hotel is a nice bar to sit and just across the street leftwardsthere is the Ember restaurant: to die for. The Saff is close to the middle of Chinatown, withe excellent restaurants and Neil Street with the gay bars. We like this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Small But very good!!”
Reviews.Author: ron18us
Reviews.Content: The Saff is situated in china town a midst of old Chinatown culture, busy restaurant that serve amazing food and lovely multinational architecture! The hotel itself is so beautiful and interior done to suit the china town culture. Keep in mind that this hotel has no meal plan, but you have plenty of places to eat around and for breakfast you can just cross the road to 1929, where they serve a nice breakfast buffet! The only negative thing is that the rooms are very small and some don t even have a window, but the rooms are very clean and well kept and the staff itself is very helpful and nice. the hotel is close to the bus and the MRT and has lots of amazing attractions around it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: nayanayanaya
Reviews.Content: Our stay was ok in this hotel. It's located in chinatown, surrounded by pubs and bars, so there would be some noise. Most of the sound comes from the left side, so a bit noisy on that side of the hotel, so I'd recommend to request the right wing. The room for single room is very small, but for the double room is ok. The most important thing is that the room is clean. My tip is to book as early as possible to get the good rates, otherwise it'll be a bit expensive to what you gonna get. The standard room (3rd room) has no windows, so bear that in mind. This hotel deserves 3 star from me.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: desktraveller101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. It's in a good location in Chinatown (although a Western-style breakfast was hard to find) and is decorated nicely - a bit quirky with bright colours. However it is located on a very loud road, so much so that we had to move rooms in the middle of the night (not fun)! And we're in our late 20s, so can handle some noise! Ask for a back room - they're much quieter (even if they have no windows). The rooms were very clean, but I don't think I'll be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located renovated boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wollywobbel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Hotel is beautifully decorated in boutique style and the exterior is in colonial style. I reserved the room via booking.com, but could not choose the type of bed. I emailed the hotel asking for 2 single beds/twin room and got a quick reply from the manager that he reserved this preference for us. We arrived at 2 o'clock in the morning, and after quick checkin procedure we entered our room. We reserved the cheapest room type (which had no windows), which was good value for money. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was really small but clean and the lavender smell bathroom amenities were very good. A fridge could be a welcome addition to the room. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but the cafe across the street serve strong, freshly brewed coffee and kaya toast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, near chinatown”
Reviews.Author: stevegwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 21 june for 5 nights. We got there early due to flight times from england. We were allowed to check in and they upgraded us to a deluxe room. No window but a great size room, small bathroom with lovely rainfall shower. It was quiet where we were. So no problems from noise from the street. Staff were very friendly, wifi was great in room. Small fridge in room came in handy, Great location to chinatown and mrt which we used all the time. Rooms were clean and well maintained, lovely big bed very comfortable. Stored our luggage on our last day and rang for a taxi to take us to the train station. Overall good hotel enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “No no no way!!!”
Reviews.Author: Russette
Reviews.Content: We will never ever go back to this hotel. It is sooooooo expensive and the place is so nasty. The room is sooooo small and no window. Hotel 81 is cheaper and better. The staff is not helpful. My stay in singapore is not sooo good because of this hotel. Terrible. Really terrible. If you want a giid stay in spore.... Try other hotel but never saff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable. Extremely small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Katzistan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a recent visit to Singapore. First, the bed was amazingly comfortable. My wife and I both needed sleep coming off intense work periods, and this was a hugely important asset. We slept sooooo well. Now that I am back in my own bed, I miss that one. There's everything you need in the room, but important to know - it's very small. We were shocked when we arrived - reminded me of those closet-room hotels in Paris. They've done well with the limited space, all the amenities are there (could use a bigger shelf to put stuff in the bathroom), and it's nice the power outlets accept all different kinds of plugs. After a couple days though, we didn't mind - the staff are very nice and helpful, and it's not like we were spending a ton of waking time in the hotel room anyway. I would definitely recommend the place, just important to know about room size before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Biology-Teacher308
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to explore Singapore. It is in Chinatown and within a 5 minute walk to the Chinatown MRT or the Outram Park MRT. There are lots of food options in the area and it is close to go out in the evening to the nightly street "party" they have. However, you are just far enough away from some of the things that we found the area to be pretty quiet. The room was small (we expected it), but functional. It had a safe and a small refrig which was nice to have. We did not have a window, but it wasn't too bad. We were not in the room that long to really spend a lot of time there. It was also clean. The bed and the pillows were comfortable. I think that it is the location that really makes it special.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel for layover, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Zaquablue
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small. And without windows. We only wanted a cheap place to stay 1 night in Singapore between flights and we were very pleased with our choice. The location in the olde Chinatown was perfect! Great food on Smith St which is only 100m walk. Singapore is a beautiful city and if I was here for an extended time then I would choose another hotel but for our needs it hit the spot!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy! This hotel seem to be built on paper all over.”
Reviews.Author: Pokypie
Reviews.Content: Noisy! This hotel seem to be built on paper all over. U can basically hear noises from all four directions if u are put on the second floor. One thing seem ridiculous was whenever the people staying above you moved around. You can basically prepared for a series of stomping noises from the ceiling. And good luck if the guest upstairs chose to stay up in the night. Also, noises of slumping doors from neighbors are like regular everyday! When I checked with the reception, they denied complaints of the noises from previous guest. If you decide to put up at this hotel, I would suggest you bring your headphones.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent stay.”
Reviews.Author: jia284
Reviews.Content: We took a staycation on a Saturday. The location is really convenient, near to many interesting eating places and very near to public transport. However, service staff was not very friendly. We went to the reception to request for wine glasses, but a surly receptionist brushed us off and said they don't have any. Room is very basic, superior queen. Simple and clean. There's a bar downstairs that has a live band that plays from 10 to 12 pm. If u intend to sleep early with no interruptions, you might want to check if the band is playing.

Reviews.Title: “A CHARMING BOUTIQUE HOTEL IN CHINATOWN”
Reviews.Author: lyntregoning
Reviews.Content: The Saff has been recently renovated very tastefully. The rooms are a good size, very colourful and have windows. Very clean. The staff are very friendly & helpful. The street it is in is very interesting itself. Taxis are plentiful. Only a short walk to shops and lots of restaurants that are very cheap for Singapore. Try the local beer - it's good. The Saff is not far from major attractions by taxi. When you go out the front door turn left walk to the end of the street and there is a clothing market on the right that leads into Chinatown stall type street market. Very interesting just walking around the block!

Reviews.Title: “1001 nights”
Reviews.Author: kimherben
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great atmosphere, the only thing i did not like was the fact that the standard rooms have no windows. felt a bit "lock-ed" up

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller008
Reviews.Content: Beware of bait-and-switch. Booked and pre-paid for a room through a hotel booking website and when we arrived were told that we had to pay more for the room. The price they quoted was 70% more than the price we had already paid. If we wanted an extra bed for a smaller room that would be an extra 40%. The stoney receptionist actually had the audacity to ask if we wanted to cancel the booking - with no refund. When we wanted to call the website they said they couldn't make international calls from the hotel. There was also no internet connection if we wanted to send them an email. These turned out to be lies as there's wifi included in the room rate and the hotel most definitely has the capacity to make international calls. After it became obvious that we weren't going to fall for their bait-and-switch tactics and weren't going to just go away, three staff members had a meeting and then told us that since we insisted on contacting the booking website, they had to honour the reservation. Unbelievable that anyone would even try the old bait-and-switch in this day and age. Of course the room we are given has no windows and is extremely claustrophobic. All staff completely ignore us and refuse even basic eye contact for our entire stay. There are so many places to stay in singapore. Just beware and stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, clean and neat !!”
Reviews.Author: hans73
Reviews.Content: The Saff is a very cosy hotel in ChinaTown, its a no frills hotel with small rooms but very cosy, neat and clean, free wi fi is great, centrally located in ChinaTown, loads of restaurants and pubs closeby, 5 minutes from the ChinaTown MRT. Would recommend it to people who use the hotel only to sleep and spend the rest of the day otuside. No breakfast is served but there are places closeby. The place of course is reasonble for Singapore standards...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: aloisw8
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular in Singapore always looking for somewhere different from the large 5* chains which can often make you feel 'processed' or the flea bitten cheapies around the city. Thought we would try the newly refurbished Saff [formerly the Peacock] This is the sister hotel to the Scarlet ...so expectations were high and we were not disappointed. We arrived early and were greeted by a delightful receptionist who made us feel valued and immediately at home...and arranged for a bright room with windows overlooking the pretty Keong Saik Rd some 6 hours before check in...this is rare! The Saff is in a row of converted shop houses so space is at a premium. They manage this well which makes the room feel luxurious and cozy... a great refuge after a day in the city. Free wifi, in room fridge, and quality amenities in the shower room. The area is hip and lively with great authentic family run eateries to explore close by for breakfast to dinner as this is not available at the hotel...this is not a problem to me. I will return to this hotel with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “At Last I Have Found An Affordable, Clean, Well Positioned Hotel In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: acerockolla
Reviews.Content: When ever we stay in Singapore it is for one or two nights at most and I always try to book something that is affordable as we won';t be spending hours in the room. So far this has proved to be a fairly flawed plan, with uncomfortable beds, bedbugs, dirty bathrooms etc. Well, at last I have found the place. The Saff Hotel is just yards from the Outram Rark MRT, Is in an area, that really feels like a hip, happening area, lot's of eating, drinking and shopping options near by. The outside of the hotel is very attractive and clean. The reception is small but very cool looking. The first thing that struck me was how clean the hotel was, the lift was small but also very smart. Our room was small but beautifully decorated, very clean with a window with a view over the air conditioning units to nowhere (you cant have everything). The room has a modern flat screen TV with 5 channels including Star Movies, BBC News and Asia News, There was a safe in the room and a fridge. free in room wifi is a plus. The bathroom was also small but was perfectly usable and again clean with decent complimentary bathroom essentials. There is no restaurant at hotel, but that's no big deal as there are lot's of options all around. This is the best good value hotel I have found in Singapore, I have been lucky enough to stay in a couple of much more expensive hotels and frankly the rooms are not a lot different and in fact usually have less personality. Would I go back to this hotel? Yes, Well, here's the deal, If I am going to Singapore and have to pay my own money for a room I would book this hotel again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, good value”
Reviews.Author: scancat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in March 2011. I had read some bad reviews of the Saff just before our trip and got so worried we nearly cancelled our booking at the last minute. However, we stayed and could have not been happier! The staff was friendly and efficient. Location great - very close to Outram Park Station and near also to Chintatown station. Nice little coffee shops and restaurants on the same street. Ok so the rooms ARE small *which they are upfront about on their website*, BUT they are well equipped, clean, nicely furnished and quiet. The bed was very comfortable, the TV nice flat screen with good reception. Free wi-fi in rooms,which was fast. The bathrooms are tiny but very clean and well planned. I really found this to be great value for money and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Comfortable and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: monski0903
Reviews.Content: We are only a family of three. We have a 12 year old son, who is considered to be an adult already when you checked into a hotel. I was having difficulty finding a hotel that wouldn't charge an extra bed for my son because it is so expensive. That is what i like about The Saff. Aside from have a very good location, they didn't charge an extra bed for my son. Our room consists of two single bed placed side by side which is like a King size bed already and is more than comfortable enough for us three to sleep in. Beside, we are only there really to sleep and with all the walking done during the day, we are so tired that it won't matter anymore where we lay our exhausted bodies. The room was very clean. There's a 32" LCD TV with 5 channels. A free wi-fi and a PC in the lobby which you can use for free if you don't have a laptop. Everything works great. The Hotel Staffs were very courteous also. The place is about 300 meters walk to the nearest bus stations. When we return to Singapore, this will still be the place that we'll be staying. Singapore is a very expensive country to live in. Finding this hotel is like finding a gem. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BorodBorod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 3 different budget hotels during our layovers in Singapore. This was the best one for the value. It was the cleanest of all three - VERY clean and no overlooked spots, especially in the bathroom. It looked like they actually took time to wipe it off, clean the applicances, etc. - not merely change your toilet paper. As everyone says in their Singapore hotel reviews, the room was fairly small, but it was enough for us two. There was no window, but again, for the price and especially in comparison with the other 2 hotels, that was the least of our concerns. It was neatly decorated, and the entire hotel was nice and welcoming. Good location: in the heart of Chinatown, close to 2 or 3 MRT stations. Highly recommend this hotel and would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “really a chine town type hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanforge
Reviews.Content: good place to live in the boutique hotel, yes hotel is nice and clean and good locality, near to china town mrt, walking distance to clarke quay for night life and clubing, yes being a boutique hotel so no breakfast and no room service for food, thanks they give every day 2bottles of water and need to upgrade for movie channels, value for money

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: varpetra
Reviews.Content: The Saff hotel is as beautiful as it's shown on the pictures. I loved the design, the colours, the atmosphere. It is a very comfortable place in middle of Chinatown, very good location. The only problem was that there are two bars next to the hotel and they are very loud every day of the week until late.

Reviews.Title: “Location - great, fast free in room wifi, nice decorated roomy rooms but noisy”
Reviews.Author: rmm69
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel we stayed in at the end of our time in Singapore. Tried two rooms - the standard room which was windowless and the deluxe room which had windows that faced the street. Standard room was good, enough room to leave our suitcase open and have space to walk around, marvel at the interior design whilst listening to our neighbour talk on the phone. Yes, the walls are thin. Luckily there was no rampant love making next door. All rooms have tea making facilites and a small fridge. The window room was noisy and would make me reluctant to stay here again. Sleep disrupted, in the morning I would stare with red eyes longingly at the boutique hotel across the street (hotel 1929) whose rooms also had street facing windows but, without them being bolted open, the occupants were able to open and close them at will to shut out the noise. Ah, the joys of life. We stayed over a weekend so the adjacent pub was in full swing and there were plenty of people on the street. Mid week there didn't seem to be this problem, but we were in the windowless thin walled room back then. I suspect the deluxe window room also has thin walls or maybe just less noisy neighbours. The downside to booking this place is not being sure if you get a noisy room or not. The place is delightful apart from the noise - so if you are willing to take a gamble on sleep quality - or will be one of the people out on the street making the noise - go ahead and book it - or bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean with free wi-fi & water.”
Reviews.Author: Minivan555
Reviews.Content: SAFF Hotel is more of a budget-level boutique hotel. Suitable for short stays and couples and singles; not for family. Rooms are very small and you should request one with a window, preferably not facing the street so it is quieter. Free internet and daily complimentary water bottle is a nice touch. Clean & friendly service. It has a great location near the train station and is convenient for food. Across the street is an old-style coffeeshop famous with locals for its strong coffee and morning toast. 2 doors down is a chinese old restaurant famous for pepper crabs and easy chinese food. A nearby 7-11 shop makes it convenient. Next door is an American cafe. For fine dining, cross the street to Hotel 1929 and make a reservation at Ember. I liked walking around Chinatown for sight seeing. Good local experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: xtnjohnson
Reviews.Content: The Saff is a beautifully renovated small hotel in the midst of a small hotel ghetto in Chinatown. Chinatown's a great neighborhood and the hotel is convenient to the MRT and to cabs. Free Wi-Fi is a very nice touch and worked beautifully in the two rooms I used. The rooms tend to be small, the bathrooms smaller, and the showers positively microscopic. As is so often the case in Asia's less-expensive lodgings, the showers in both rooms were less than 2' x 2' square. I'm 6' 1" and the showerheads came up only to my shoulder blades -- thankfully I'm slim and limber but it could be a real issue for someone a little larger or less mobile. When I checked in, an 8-piece Dutch band was in front of me so that naturally overwhelmed the front desk for a while. And that should've given me a hint that there might be trouble ahead. I didn't quite realize it at the time, but the Saff has a bar (with separate entrance and its own name) -- which, crucially, hosts live music on weekends. I always sleep with earplugs anyway so I thought it'd be no problem -- but in my first room (I think it was 232) I could feel the vibration. At about 12:45 a.m. I called downstairs, miserable, and they said it would stop at 1:00. Which it did, exactly on the dot, but I still didn't feel well rested. The next morning I asked to be moved, and they put me in a room at the back that was dead, dead, dead quiet (Room 201). So, if you're looking to sleep before 1 a.m. on a Friday or Saturday night, please ask the front desk -- there are rooms that are totally insulated. Even when I was grumpy about my lack of sleep, the staff were very nice and moved me with no problem at all. All that said, the Saff is good value for money so long as either you plan to stay out late anyway or you ask for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkhkid
Reviews.Content: Deluxe rooms that I had stayed in were very clean, nice beds, nicely decorated, flat screen TV. Staffs were nice and helpful and location of hotel is close to MRT station, Outram Park. There is a good Nasi Padang restaurant a few doors away. Food courts are within a 10 min taxi ride. However do not take rooms on the left hand side(when facing hotel) if you want quiet rooms. Before midnight loud music will be blaring from adjacent music bars. I learnt that it stops only around 1 am (I cannot verify this as I asked to switch room before that) and it was not even a weekend!!.

Reviews.Title: “Beside a bar, so VERY noisy!”
Reviews.Author: rolandmirjana
Reviews.Content: Room booked via Expedia for approx 200 S dollar per night and we stayed on a Thursday and Friday. Ok, let's be honest; The Saff has a good location and price/quality looks good. HOWEVER they "forgot" to mention our room was along side a live band and karaoke bar so the noise was horribly loud and I'm not a light sleeper! The guy at the reception told us the bar closes at 2am (!) and wanted to give us another room. A bit to late I think as they should mention this in advance! My advice is look for other options in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Small business hotel ideal for stopover - Cheap but good.”
Reviews.Author: hinikuru
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights during our stopover to Bali. Stayed in the really small standard room with no window then the superior room which was a tad bigger with a window and a view of air con units. The rooms are fine. Modern and clean albeit small. If you are on a budget and don't need a pool in Singapore and want somewhere central and dont mind a tiny tiny room then this is fine. The room is tiny but nicely decorated in an Indian style. Has a big tv only 5 channels. Free WiFi is a major plus point. beside a 7 eleven also and a small bar with outside seating. Also in Chinatown so its very central (2 stops to Vivo City/Bay) Because in Chinatown you can walk down and get some great food If you aren't on a budget then go to marina bay sands but if you are then this place is good - close to a cultural centre, nice chinese food, and its cheap clean and modern budget accommodation for singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Small, a little noisy but clean and modern, perfect for short sightseeing trip!”
Reviews.Author: ScottJM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in February and really enjoyed it. It's a comfortable, stylish hotel in Chinatown with very clean and modern rooms. The rooms are in no way large and unfortunately we had a room with a window onto the main road outside, this meant it was very noisy. There was also a door for staff behind our room (as we were at the end of the corridor) which continuously slammed but the hotel staff were very quick to get somebody to look at the door and stop it slamming so hard. It's close to the public transport network, the city bus tour stops and there is some nice restaurants and quick food places nearby. Perfect for a sightseeing trip, would recommend to anybody and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel - The Saff, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: philingfishy
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip recently to Singapore and decided to stay at the Saff after my business meetings since it was quite well priced. I loved the ambiance and my wife loves the decor. My only qualms were what looked like a lady boy who hangs out outside the hotel. What I like is the free internet use, close by to some MRT stations, and very accessible to food. However, do ask for a room at the quieter section of the hotel. I actually checked into the Saff after spending a few days staying at the Marina Sands (I am pampered and used to large hotels thanks to my company but...) and wasn't hoping for much but for the price and all that comes with it, I am impressed. All in all I love the Saff and will definitely go there again when I go to Singapore for a holiday. I love it so much I decided to do a pocode for them. Go to www.pocode.com and key in this pocode HY8#ETF96 and I recommend them to everyone.... Guys, if you're reading... keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: TravellerS1703
Reviews.Content: We were only in Singapore for one night and were looking for somewhere clean and comfortable at a good price. We had seen some not so favourable comments but decided to take the risk and it paid off. The Saff is in a great location on the edge of China Town. Excellent for reasonably priced food and drink. If you want to pay a bit more, or see the sites, many are within walking distance and if you don't fancy walking there is a metro station nearby. I have read about the rooms being small and noisy. Our room was a great size. Perfectly adequate. It was beautifully decorated and very clean. It was mentioned on arrival on arrival that our room was nearer a bar and the receptionist asked us if that was ok or would we prefer to move. I am a light sleeper and the faint music I could hear was not an issue and finished relatively early. I would definately recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night”
Reviews.Author: BrockleyKaz
Reviews.Content: Cool, funky decor. Room was very small and without windows, but fine for the one night we were staying there. Bed was comfortable and the air-con was effective. Free wifi. Location was good - near the train and the tourist hop-on hop-off bus.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Manicscud
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at saff. Recommend to everyone. Close to Chinatown markets. Only one slight drama. Not very bright lights in room. Maybe didn't switch right lights on. Labels on switches would have helped. Again excellent service, room. We had a window room. Thanks to all the staff Steve

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Truthteller0915
Reviews.Content: Some rooms are unbearly noisy. There is low noise from Karaok from the third floor. I couldn't sleep at all after long flights. The room is small and smells moldish. I read some reviews that had some complaints, which I didn't pay special attention to. Here I advise you not to come to this hotel, where you can get any rest at night.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible find!”
Reviews.Author: Weanny
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to any fellow traveler. This is such a nice and cute hotel and very well located. Very close to the Outram Part MRT station and also the Chinatown MRT station, you could choose either one. The neighborhood is also a plus since The Saff is located in the heart of the old preserved heritage of the Chinatown. You will have a very nice time to take pictures in this neighborhood. I also like the hotel colorful paint with distinctive doors colors and ethnic decors. A very picturesque view and quaint. Definitely charming. My only downside from this hotel is that I didn’t get a king or queen bed as well as the window, as this trip was also a romantic get away from me so this situation is not very ideal. Another plus thing from The Saff for me is that I actually missed my flight on the day I was supposed to go so I had to go the day after and The Saff was kind enough to waive the first night, for this I am very grateful. There was also a problem with the air conditioner on my last day of stay and apparently they were doing some repairing for the whole 1st fl and as a consequence my room was quite hot in the morning. Thanks God I was checking out so it didn’t disturb me a lot. But overall, I was very satisfied to stay in this hotel and I will definitely returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: noside666
Reviews.Content: I had a gd price as I booked thru booking.com and I paid sgd$128 for a night stay. the room was quite small and is windowless. however, it is very clean and the toilet is spacious enough for one to enjoy a gd shower. There weren't any toothbrushes thus we rang up e front desk to enquire. The staff, Marty, was really nice and he brought us the toothbrushes! Phew. We were really pleased and overall the stay was enjoyable and peaceful as there weren't any noises to disturb our zz. My only regret was forgettin to leave a tip for the housekeeper e nxt day before we left as it was such a hurry. But I'll definitely be back n give a big tip nxt time!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely designed but the rooms are (too) small”
Reviews.Author: Juledan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our last stop before we had to return to Europe. Last year we stayed in the (big) sister hotel "The Scarlet" and as we had a good experience there we decided to try The Saff. The Saff opened doors at the end of last year and at the time of booking there were no user reviews so we were in for a surprise. Our arrival was ok: for a minute we expected porter service considering the roomprice and the class of the hotel but there was none. The lady from reception helped us however, because she didn't want us to drag our suitcases by ourselves. A plus for her :-). Check-in went smoothly and we were brought to our room by another s(t)aff member. As soon as the door opened we were shocked by the size of our standard double room. While all the necessary things (tv, towels, tea and coffee making facilities, shampoo, hairdryer etc.) were there it was just too small; the bathroom was built in a cupboard. Guests with claustrophobia will definitely have a hard time. After we managed to fit our suitcases on the other side of the bed and one on the cupboard we could at least walk to the "bathroom". We went back to reception and asked for an upgrade but unfortunately the hotel was fully booked. As other hotels in Singapore were also fully booked (except the ones that are like S$1000/S$2000 a night or the ones that had a rating of "terrible") we tried to make the best of it. We managed to see a superior room later during the week which was a little bigger and it would have been more acceptable although even that room was small when you compare the room with similar rooms in Singapore. The room was very clean. The hotel is is new so here and there there is still some paintsmell but that did not bother us. You do get a big LCD-tv but with only five channels of which four are newschannels the value was limited to us. The experience with the reception varied: sometimes they did not pay attention at all (or where not there), other times in the middle of a conversation they would suddenly help other guests and now and then they were helpful and gave you their full attention as it should be. The rooms are nicely designed but the walls are thin. At one point we were woken up by other guests talking in the middle of the night. Streetnoise however was not hearable. The location of The Saff is excellent. It is a five minutes walk from the MRT station Outram Park and from there most of Singapore is reachable. As the hotel is in the middle of Chinatown there is always good food around, business and interesting things to do and places to see. The Saff has free Wifi around the hotel. The speed is quite reasonable: fast enough for checking email or surfing. All in all we think The Saff is a new hotel that needs to iron out a few details to make the whole experience better for guests. We do think that the photos on the website do not represent the (standard) rooms well enough and that is why we are disappointed. If we had to return to Singespore and choose a boutique hotel we would return to The Scarlet. If we had to stay in The Saff then we would book at least a superior double room but then again only if there would be a good deal otherwise it is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “A simple hotel but made my visit to Singapore truly pleasurable.”
Reviews.Author: enjoysingapore
Reviews.Content: The Saff is an ideal hotel for the practical traveler. Truly quaint and old wordly. Very clean and quiet. The staff are helpful. Although the hotel does not have an in-house restaurant, modest coffee houses are a stone's throw away. Transportation is not a problem. Train station is a 7 minutes walk and taxis ply the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rendezvous Location in Heart of the City/Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: callipris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Saff during Christmas time and found it to be very charming and the location was quite central. The MRT stop was just a few mins away and just around the corner there is no shortage of great food and cafes. (Stay away from the food street -- big tourist trap!) By cab it was also easy to find because of the Indian temple nearby. Walk 5 mins and you get to the Pinnacle @ Duxton; walk 10 mins the Maxwell Center for chicken rice; 10 mins for Ang Siang Hill. The entire area is very cute and quaint. The decor is very Indian/SE Asian-inspired so the rooms are quite colorful and different from your standard business hotel. As for the rooms itself, they were considerably smaller than I expected. Since I stayed for about 5 days, two people + luggage cut down the amount of space we had to move around. The closet is also very tiny so not much room to put your clothes in there. Also, if you're big on bathrooms, the door to the bathroom looks like an antique closet with french doors. (I was half thinking I'd step into the "closet" and be wisked off to Narnia.) The doors don't close that well so for those that want their privacy, you may think twice. Sometimes I felt like I was staying in a small HK apt. than a hotel. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay. It was a great pick for a romantic rendezvous. The room was quiet and cleaned up quite nicely. The staff were also helpful. They didn't give us a late check out but did let us keep our luggage for a couple hours before our flight. I probably would stay at the hotel again if I came back with my honey but not alone. Pros: - Location is great - Very cute decor - Cozy - Quiet - Dim lighting for romantic feel - Prompt service Not so great parts: - Very minimal toiletries (no toothbrushes!) - Hair dryer is mounted to the wall - Not a lot of lighting when you need it - Smaller than expected

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy room but don't choose the rooms facing the streets!”
Reviews.Author: Jacyst
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 31st dec 2010 till 3rd jan 2011. We were given a superior room with windows although we booked a standard room with no windows. The first night was a disaster. Our room was facing the street and it was very noisy. There were disco/karaoke and shops nearby and the noise continued until 6o'clock in the morning! We requested to change to another room and were given a room facing the backyard which was very quiet and nice. Love the decoration in the hotel and the room. The staff were very friendly. Good and safe location, it's just 5minutes walk to Outram Park MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean bright rooms, exceptionally freindly staff, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Aussie255093
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Saff from the airport after a 15 hour flight 3 hours before check-in. I was visibly exhausted and travelling alone so the lovely staff upgraded me to one of their superior rooms for free so I could go straight to bed. Rooms are small but clean and bright with big TV. Great affordable accommodation and very close to the metro station. I was pleasantly surprised with the Saff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Marija45
Reviews.Content: The Saff hotel is located in the outskirts of China town, in what used to be the red light district some time ago and it's now place for small boutique hotels, nice eateries and coffee shops. Close by are the wonderful "Club Street" and Ann Siang hill, great places for later afternoon/evening stroll. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the Outram MRT station. Overall great location. The room was very clean, the bathroom was excellent, however the hotel must have been renovated recently because the room smelled like fresh paint. We couldn't open the windows (perhaps for security reasons as the hotel is low rise) but they gave us an air ionizer which worked out ok. The room (and hotel) decor is very nice and colorful, but our room was bit small for the price. Also, our room was facing the main street where a lot of restaurants (opened 'till late) are located so it was bit noisy at night. Better to ask for room overlooking the quieter side if possible. Overall it's was quite comfortable stay and despite the layout and sort of crowded street (lots of hotels, shops, etc.) the whole atmosphere in the hotel and the surroundings is laid back so it's possible to relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: weazelksu
Reviews.Content: Company put us up here while waiting for our corporate apartment to be ready. We arrived late on a Saturday night and were given a "garden level" room (superior double). The room had small windows and smelled a bit damp. The next day we asked to be moved to a room with more natural light and were given a room on the 2nd floor that worked out much better. The hotel was recently remodeled so it was in great condition. The room was a good size but the bathroom was a bit small. Great shower heads. The beds were two singles pushed together and not a double or queen. A bit odd but they were comfy. The TV was a new flat screen but there were only 5 channels, which was disappointing. There are minimal amenities. No breakfast or work out room. This was an issue for us since we were there for a week. The staff was very helpful and nice. The location is great. There were eateries every where and we were able to walk to many sites. I would stay there again but would prob keep the stay to less than three nights.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to begin our holiday...”
Reviews.Author: PK46
Reviews.Content: Let's get the slightly disappointing bits out the way first; we went for the intermediate priced room (it had a window, the cheaper ones do not) which was quite small; the double bed could only be accessed from one side which is fine if you're young, nimble and full of the exuberance of youth but for us of a certain age and aching vertebra this was a bit of a challenge. The aircon was very efficient (and very much needed) , staff were helpful and friendly; convenient for Chinatown district and close to the MRT station and links to City centre and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated, smart design, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: basedinbeijing
Reviews.Content: Judging from earlier reviews this hotel must have been pretty dodgy before its renovation. But the Saff is now a delightful boutique hotel with much charm and character. The rooms are small (I was in a single room) but smartly designed and nicely decorated. Excellent value and all in all a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Saff Experiance”
Reviews.Author: Daanny
Reviews.Content: Definitely well worth the money! The location is great, newly refurbished, service minded staff. The new management have done a great job! I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: frodoman
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here while on business. This hotel is a 180 change from former life as Royal Peacock. Rooms are small, but adequate, even cute. Very clean. Some street noise but none from adjoining rooms. Very well managed. No breakfast but free wifi is a great help. Easy walk to financial district, China town, MRT. Felt safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel. Stay away from it. The...”
Reviews.Author: Aftrbrn
Reviews.Content: Bad hotel. Stay away from it. The pictures might look good but its not even close in reality. No windows for the common type rooms which made it look like a dormitory. Then again, Ive been in much worse.

Reviews.Title: “No royal treatment but still a great and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier_Dr
Reviews.Content: Good, value for money, trendy hotel. Free internet was also very useful although it is cabled. Room was on the tight side, but still manageble. Hotel consists of a few pre-war shoplots, beautifully restored, giving it that British colonial feel. Location is reasonable, walking distance to LRT station and also to Chinatown. Also have breakfast but I missed it due to tight schedule. Not sure how are the other hotels as there are a few just nearby but I have no complains on this.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzyguy
Reviews.Content: Sorry folks, this one is just not good. My room had no window (I knew that when I booked and I can life with that from time to time) BUT, the wall connecting to the next room was so thin (made of plywood) that I could hear EVERYTHING from the guest next door. Scratching, coughing, snoring and other unwelcome sounds. The bathroom was humid and not clean. The bed was short and covered with one of those old brown itchy and scratchy blankets. Breakfast was lousy too. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “the royal peakcock is lost”
Reviews.Author: lizartBroome
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was in Chinatown and central. We found it on the Loney Planet site and it said what the rooms lack in windows and space more than make up for the character. Well it lacked everything, the rooms were small and moldey and smelt. We asked to be moved to another room which the staff happily did and it was exactly the same - smelly. I don't know how the hot water system worked but it didn't. The aircon was dirty and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews on this site! Don't stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mooey76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Royal Peacock for two nights as part of a 3 day stopover in Singapore. I was a bit dubious about booking this hotel due to the bad reviews written on Trip Advisor but a friend, who had stayed at this hotel before (and would be meeting us in Singapore) said it wasn't as bad as the reviews said. Well.....we should have trused the reviews! We paid extra money for a superior suite (and resquested a window room when booking) and were given a basement room at the back of the hotel which was just disguisting! The room was very musty and smelt extremely bad, the carpet was very damp, there were water marks all down the walls and patches of damp and mould all over the roof. The room gave the impression that it would make you sick if you stayed in it! Our friends were staying at the same hotel and had booked a budget room which cost them less and turned out to be nicer than the room we had (and bit more like the room pictures shown on the internet) - but it was pretty ordinary as well. The place just had a very neglected and unhealthy feel about it. We promptly packed up and left and found a much better room at a hotel directly across the street for the same price without the mould, moisture or smell!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Marrilal
Reviews.Content: The Royal Peacock is quaint. A room at the back with a window is essential. We have stayed there twice. Try to find somewhere in such a good location cheaper in Singapore, impossible!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Velkrin
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice staff, but the building is in poor condition. We were given a windowless attic room with a broken fridge, poor AC and a bathroom sink that only had cold water. The walls were paper thin so you have to like the same television channel as your neighbor. The second night we were there we were awakened before dawn by pounding on the door and told to leave immediately because of a suspected gas leak. I was surprised that there was no fire alarm system other than staff going door to door. Ilive in Viet Nam and in this country we would rank it as a 1-star backpacker hotel. The price (US$67 per night) was about $60 too high,

Reviews.Title: “Mouldy & Musty”
Reviews.Author: DarwinGirl82
Reviews.Content: We booked the cheapest room through wotif and were told that our room wouldn't have a window. When we checked in, we found that our room did have good sized windows, however the room was very musty and there was a big patch of mould on the ceiling. Our friends booked a superior suite through wotif and were allocated a very small room with no windows at the rear of the hotel that mas much mustier and had a lot more mould and dampness than our room. Positives: great location, free in-room broadband.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but high prices”
Reviews.Author: anuban1977
Reviews.Content: Located in between the beautiful, 24 hours busy China Town district of Singapore. The rooms and the washrooms are too small but have all the required facilities. limited service restaurant is available in the hotel. If compared to the room & others, the price is on higher side, but the location of the hotel compensates to this. the staff is very friendly and polite. main tourist attractions eg. suntec city mall, mariamman temple, singapore flyer, duck tours starting point, little india etc. are on 10-15 minutes drive from hotel. you can get a singapore local city map if you want to walk down the beautiful streets of china town.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: keithk_nyc
Reviews.Content: i would not stay again for free...despite the sweet and helpful staff, the facility is a wreck...dirty carpets, bad air conditioning in all THREE rooms I tried...extremely noisy in the front (neighborhood) and in the back (air conditioning for the whole building) and all 3 rooms smelled like cigarettes...this was a terrible experience, i have stayed in 5 dollar youth hostels that were comfortable...oh, and a lousy breakfast, too.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: backgammonfern
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to MRT station, which is good. The location and the surrounding area is also good, as part of China Town. I was also excited when I saw the look from the outside, but not so excited when entering the hotel and the room. The room needs a lot of work just to make it to an 'OK'. Wall is peeling, shower room smelled bad, AC was noisy, cupboard with no lights. I took a room with a window facing the street, but I regretted after that. It was very at night from people talking on the street. I left the hotel, and went to another one which was more expensive, but so much better in terms of the condition of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: sunshine44418
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with the Royal Peacock. It was overpriced and is past its glory. The hotel needs a facelift -- it's tired and shabby and I didn't find any redeeming qualities in it. The A/C was noisy, inefficient and dusty; my room had a window but backed onto the noisy compressors for the A/C for the building; tiles in the bathroom were cracked and mildewed; and the shower was a trickle of water that went from burning hot to cold. If you're willing to pay for the Royal Peakcock, splurge a bit and go across the street to a beautiful boutique hotel -- Hotel 1929.

Reviews.Title: “Could be nice, But....”
Reviews.Author: ben80361
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Royal Peacock on the weekend of August 1-3, 2009. I've been checking tripadvisor before booking and notice that the cheapest type has no window, so I booked a superior single room with window facing the street. First impression was not too bad, I mean after all they offer a good rate in the very good location... well considering the price that I pay for it, I can't complain. The room is very compact but ok, surprised a bit by the feather pillow, noisy ac, leaking bathroom wall (yes the photos shown here are so true!)... it's ok and worth it. plus it gives you free high speed internet, too (with cable) So I had been quite happy until the late evening came... and the nightmare started as it was saturday night! :) There is this crappy bar right next door (called the bini bini or something) with very loud live music until early morning (4.30 am) and countless "boom boom pow" playing every 15 minutes (maybe it was very popular at that time in singapore) until now I officially hate that song (sorry, BEP!). First I was hanging there in the room trying to sleep because I thought they would only be allowed until 2 am max. At 2.30, they were still very loud so finally I decided to walk around chinatown. As I was walking out the hotel I saw other guests who were staying at the surrounding hotels (1929 & g hotel), also walking around outside and didnt look happy at all, I saw one guy with his short and sandals carrying his novel trying to find a place to sit & read - obviously he couldn't sleep like me and hated the noise so much :) Finally after 4.30 the noises stopped. Luckily the weird evening was saved by the quiet sunday morning in chinatown. The breakfast served was cheering me up too with the congee, sausages, eggs, fried rice... a bit surprising breakfast if you compare it with the room condition. So final words, this could be nice, only that one crappy bar ruined the whole thing. Not recommended to stay there on Thursday, Friday & Saturday nights because these are the times when that crappy bar next door would have all-night live music. Not recommended also for people who are allergic to dust & humidity (dirty & humid & smelly carpet covering the entire building floor) Would I stay there again? Maybe yes, but not on the above-mentioned nights. And this time I would stock myself with lots of anti histamine. :)

Reviews.Title: “try to avoid”
Reviews.Author: breephd
Reviews.Content: i read the other review that said to stay on the first floor. that may be the key, b/c if you get second floor. forget it. the bathroom was ancient. the towels were dirty. asked for new ones ... "oh we'll put in new ones when we change the room" yeah, great, only staying one night. teh lobby is quaint and the little dinign room area also. btu rooms terrible. worth 50 dollars a night, no more.

Reviews.Title: “A tired old lady!”
Reviews.Author: QueenslandBrad
Reviews.Content: The smart lobby, delightful dining room and friendliness of staff was where it all stopped. The room we had was small and dingy - the double bed pushed up against the wall and no bedside table so you had to put things on the floor. It had no window so was very dark - we didn't realise it was morning until we heard the vacuum cleaner in the hall at 10 a.m. The people in the room next door had a noisy party until the late hours so we didn't get to sleep until late. It did have an airconditioner, albeit noisy. It provides tea and coffee making facilities and has a luggage storage room, which was a big plus - no provision for showering etc. after a long day in town before catching a late flight but Singapore airport has lovely showers for $8 or 5 euro. The carpets were dirty but I'm sure the staff did as best they could with an old, run down building. The outside showed lovely old shutters but a wall must have been put up over them. Perhaps some of the other rooms were better! Great position - close to Chinatown and walking distance to the historic area and even to the city if you like to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Need a window:)!”
Reviews.Author: AUSSIE7121
Reviews.Content: Hotel's located in dirty China town but close to center of Singapore. Room was dark, without window and very small. I think just for one or max 2nights no longer. Food isn't so bad, that's the best thing in hotel. In Singapore is more better hotel than this:)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful cultural experience.”
Reviews.Author: AlanGelder
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the local atmosphere & colour. We'd stayed at this hotel previously & so knew to book the authentic first floor rooms with the French Windows opening above the street.. The second floor rooms are cell-like & windowless. Breakfasts are excellent by 3* standards & we had no complaints re service or facilities whatsoever. Its central location to transport & attractions is also perfect. A great way to interrelate with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Why Go To Disneyland, When this place is so Micky Mouse.”
Reviews.Author: copperhair
Reviews.Content: This place was beyond belief. They gave us this cell called a suite with a small window that backed onto a small park. There were no curtains and you needed a light on all day so you could see. The furniture was nailed together and the place was simply disgusting. If you want to try the FEAR FACTOR try this place.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: I’m not going to be quite as damning as some of the other reviewers. But overall I would rate this place as below average. That said, the truth is that you don’t get much value for money at this level of accommodation in Singapore. I would say this place is only OK for a very short stay of a night or maybe two at the most and to be honest if I want a budget place in the area in future I will try one of the other places nearby. I was only in the hotel for around nine hours in total having flown in late in the evening prior to departure by bus to KL the following morning. The hotel is quite dowdy and in need of renovation. But I had a peaceful night’s sleep and the air con worked. The shower room was poor but just about sufficed for the morning. Breakfast was in a pleasant setting, but the food was quite basic. Check in and check out was efficient. I paid around $100 US for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: W0rldTraveller101
Reviews.Content: I walked in to book this hotel and they patently ripped me off. Price wise it was 150 Singapore dollars for 8 hours since I arrived at midnight. The room was DISGUSTING, mouldy, filthy, damp, old, no hot water and airconditioner noise. I had to double the dose of antihistamines and sleep in my clothes the beds were that unhygenic. Yuk yuk yuk.....& not even budget. Do not ever stay here

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by this hotel's website”
Reviews.Author: go-go-girl219
Reviews.Content: The Royal Peacock Hotel promotes itself as a "boutique hotel" with a three-star rating, but the facilities and cleanliness do not come close to what they claim. Our room was dark and dingy, with peeling, burned ceilings and scuffed carpets. The walls felt like they were paper-thin since we could hear each heavy step, banging doors and loud noise. The bathroom was small, with no space for a tub, having instead a tiny shower area with unfinished tiling. The rooms are in a state of disrepair and are in need of a major renovation. The reception staff are unfriendly and do not offer any voluntary assistance. When we wanted to leave our luggage with the concierge, the guy just gave as a rope and tag and left it to us to squeeze our luggage into this small room at the back of the reception area (filled with other bags). The only redeeming factor was the good condition of the bfast nook and the friendly cook and waitress. Even for the low rate of SG$135 a night, this hotel was totally not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful”
Reviews.Author: Shorthair_cat
