Reviews.Content: Worst couple hundred dollars ever spent on a hotel. The standard room I got was dark (no windows granted but the lighting was not enough to compensate), the shelves were dusty, the bathroom towel rail was falling off and the beddings looked so worn and shabby. Ditto the hallway carpet. Awkward room layout meant the desk was squashed up next to the TV. Aircon worked OK.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Peacock lost it's Feathers”
Reviews.Author: emjaydz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Thailand and Singapore. The Royal Peacock hotel in Singapore was disappointing to say the least. We booked the executive suite as we thought we would treat ourselves for 3 days in Singapore. The most disappointing thing was the price - nearly S$250 per night is absolutely outrageous for the poor quality of this hotel. To begin, there is no-one to take your bags and show you to your room, which I wouldn't mind if staying at a back packers or a budget hotel! We arrived at our room to find a queen bed with grubby pillowcases (clean, but permanently stained) and no blankets in sight - only a sheet and thin bedspread. We soon understood why as the aircon barely worked. We had two windows with wooden shutters, only when I went to open them, found that they opened onto views of large airconditioning fans, which seemed to be working - just not in our room! There was no minibar - only an empty fridge that was barely cold. When we went to bed at night, all we could hear and feel through the bed was the rumbling fans from outside our windows. The carpets were grubby, the room and bathroom smelled - not just the standard 'humid climate musty hotel room smell' either... the shower was barely warm and there was no hot water from the hand basin at all. No hand towels or face washer provided, only 2 threadbare bath towels and a bath mat. I've stayed in back packers better than this hotel for less than half the price. Extremely disappointing and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the Royal Peacock”
Reviews.Author: Bunnikin
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative review on TripAdvisor, I nearly didn't book at the Royal Peacock - but price, timing and location dictated that it was my best choice. Admittedly, the rooms were small - perhaps I wasn't so bothered by this as I'd prepared myself from the multiple reviews that had mentioned this? Or perhaps I wasn't bothered because I wasn't in Singapore to spend hours dancing around in a spacious hotel room? Anyway, they certainly jam everything in, but if you're just there to sleep or regroup, it's not problem. The facilities were fine - comfy bed, tidy bathrooms, operational fridge, air conditioning etc. A little strange how they only provided one cup and glass for a double room though... I found the service to be excellent. Staff were very helpful in letting us store our luggage as well as ensuring our valuables were stored in a safe place, booking us a taxi and helping us with local advice and directions. Oh, and the breakfast was plentiful. Given the great location (easy walk into China town's market areas, shops or to public transport), comfort and price of the place, I thought the Royal Peacock hotel was great value. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “compare to The Inn At Temple St? This is heaven”
Reviews.Author: jendhu
Reviews.Content: After much heated argument @The Inn in March, we managed to book this one in Chinatown district on our way back fr Aus. It's convenient-Outram Park MRT is just a stone throw, lots of food and shops till you drop, no more "after 11pm'' [--] (pls read our review of The Inn At Temple Street) like what we encountered @The Inn, helpful, friendly and smiling staff, free internet access, (imagine you gotta to pay S$7 @The Inn), great location and good food. Room is small but OK and clean, at least AC is working specially in the hot day like this. Will definitely introduce this hotel to friends. Keep up the good work, peacock!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some major overhaul”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel before I read TripAdvisor's reviews. What a mistake. The pictures on the website looked good and cosy, however, this is not the case when I booked in. Nice lobby reception area, however, the lift + room was a disaster. We had the superior double room which was more expensive, but later I realise the standard room is around the same, and the only difference is that we have a window. It did not help in any way though, the room we got was near the main road and extremely noisy. Here are the problems with our room: - 2 small holes in the quilt cover - Ceiling of the entrance to the toilet had a leak, which dripped at times to the carpet - Stained carpet - 21″ TV with no tuning capabilities and only 3 channels available (Ch 5, 8 & CNA) - Windows which belonged to the samsui days are great, but not soundproof enough to muffle the rumbling traffic - Fridge which barely managed to keep my wine chilled - Light switches which are not user friendly - Bad leaking between the shower hose and shower head, which spilled over the tiled floor at a corner, leading to mouldy spots. Black mouldy spots - Faulty shower head. And the water squirts everywhere to wet the wrong places when least needed - Aircon which emits whirring sounds (especially if you’re a fan of 25 deg C and below) I will not stay there again, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Stay At The Royal Peacock Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We will not stay at The Royal Peacock again. Our room (#117) was on ground floor at the back. The two windows in the room were a little larger than the size of a computer monitor. The paint on the wall was peeling off. The bathroom was wheelchair accessible, so the shower head was mounted directly on the wall with no partitions or curtains to separate the shower from the rest of the bathroom. The bathroom floor was not clean because the drain in the floor near the toilet (which is also the shower drain) collected hair from previous guests (the hair was blonde; we both have black hair).

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at Royal Peacock Hotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel, no window in the room I booked into for 5 days, the staff was perturbed that I wanted a room with a window! finally got it. Staff needs to be called several times for a wakeup call or before they send you an ironing table. Very rude and ill behaved staff. Absolutely filthy bathrooms with broken telephone shower. Gloomy rooms with no natural lighting at all. The whole place stinks (china town).. DO NOT EVER STAY AT THE ROYAL PEACOCK HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, shame about the room!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I've just come back from a stay at this hotel. I stayed in a double room (with my husband) and to say it was a small room is an understatement. The double bed was pushed up against the wall so it meant that my husband had to climb across me if he wanted to get out of bed. Also the lighting is very bad and the room very dark, but not quite dark enough to notice that the room could do with a very good clean, quite dusty and grimy in places!! For an airconditioned room, the air conditioner didn't work very well at all. The bathroom is a whole other story. Whilst it is large enough, there was mould growing on nearly every surface, especially the ceiling. The ceiling also was falling down in places. In fact when I sat on the toilet water from the room above dripped onto me. I can only hope that it wasn't from the toilet above. The hotel staff come across as being bored and uncaring. Some of them even give you wrong information on where you want to go. The only redeeming features of this hotel are the breakfasts and its location. Personally if I were to stay here again I wouldn't waste my money on a double room, instead I would ask for a delux room at the back of the building as the rooms at the front are quite noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night, but not extended stay”
Reviews.Author: poohpaws
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the attic room one night. These rooms dont have windows. It was supposed to be non-smoking but there it was smokey. It is supposed to be renovated but the carpet had definitely seen better days and looked quite grimey. Paint was also peeling and the furniture is dated. On the plus side, bed was big and very comfortable, there was storage space, and the hotel is quite atmospheric (or dark, depending how you see it). Great location and breakfast was quite good. If I stayed there again, it would have to be in a windowed room.

HotelInfo.Name: The Saff
HotelInfo.Address: 55 Keong Saik Rd, Singapore 089158, Singapore (Formerly The Royal Peacock)
